inn1.comm: starts off with a loose delivery outside off, full and angling away from the sixth stump, Masakadza watches it through to MS Dhoni
full and straight on middle, Masakadza offers the full face of the bat as he drives it back to the bowler
swings back in to beat the pad, wide called. Masakadza would be disappointed at missing out on a scoring opportunity. Just needed a faint tickle to get four there
plays all around a full inswinger on middle and leg, is hit high on the pad
lobs off the pad once again, shouts of catch but the bat was miles away as he prodded outside the line of the inswinging length ball on middle and leg
slants a length ball on off stump, tapped with soft hands to point

bends the ball back into middle and leg, Masakadza once again makes the mistake of looking to play across the line when he would have been better off playing straight, is hit on the left pad, but the ball would have missed leg
crunching cover drive on the up! It was full and swinging away, Chibhabha is authoritative in his strokeplay as he leans forward and eases the ball past the diving cover point fielder
flies off the blade again, another delightful extra cover drive, but straight to debutant Fazal
drops the length slightly shorter this time, Chibhabha is onto the back foot as he taps it to the off side
angles a full ball that shapes away from middle and off, this time it's driven down the ground to Bumrah at mid-on, dived to his left to save at least two runs
back of length delivery on off stump, plays a cross-batted defensive shot that bounces to the off side
hops across the stumps to punch one to cover. Steady start by Dhawal, didn't do much wrong even though he was crunched through cover in that over
imperious pull shot! Too short, and not much pace on that, Masakadza rocked back and pulled that in front of square, and had plenty of time to do so

this time, Sran overpitches and Masakadza lofts him over cover, didn't get hold of it but they still manage to get back for the third. Slightly gingerly on the field was Axar, on that occasion, as he gave it chase. The throw from the deep was poor
bends it back into middle and leg, Chibhabha is hit on the pad as he looks to work it to the on side, he closed the bat face a little too early
width on offer as he slants one across the batsman, left alone
driven wide of extra cover with soft hands, quick single taken. The fielder was on the edge of the circle
lucky to get away with that delivery, full and well outside off, just around the wide line. The batsman is happy to let that go
banana swing from outside off, zero foot movement from Chibhabha as he looks to drive on the up, wasn't far away from the edge
gets a good stride forward to bunt that back to the bowler
shapes away off the deck again, left alone
once again he shoulders arms to one that moves further away from outside off

indecision nearly cost him there, but he'll still get four off a thick inside edge that could have so easily cannoned into the off stump. Looks to have a go, but decides to withdraw from that outswinger t the last moment, it's too late by then as the ball deflects off the inside edge
leans forward to defend it back down the pitch
punches a full delivery back to the bowler. Could have perhaps played forward to that one, didn't get timing behind that as it wasn't as short as he expected it to be
looks to cut, is cramped for room as he chops it to the off side
good leave, looks to force it through the off side, but then drops his wrists and lets that go
back of length delivery on off stump, pushed back to the bowler again
width outside off, but he can't take full toll of that. Once again hit straight to backward point
thick outside edge, but eludes point. Bumrah, at third man, into the picture. He perhaps expected the ball to swing back in when there was none.
looks to walk across, Dhawal floats it further away, but ends up bowling it well outside the wide line
back of length delivery outside off, punched to mid-off
draws him forward with an away-swinger, but Masakadza is happy to let that go

poor shot, and Masakadza has thrown it away again by falling into the trap. It was floated full and wide, the invitation was there to drive as there was no cover fielder, but all Masakadza could do was get a thick edge that was pouched quite comfortably by Rahul at slip. He went hard at that, but the head was all over the place as he made contact.
lets the awayswinger outside off into Dhoni's gloves. That was bowled at 128 clicks
lands it a touch ahead of good length outside off, almost robotic by now, Sibanda shoulders arms
another outswinger from the fifth stump outside off, left alone
crunched on the up, but straight to mid-off
shows the full face of the bat to drive it back to Sran, who stops it on his follow-through
excellent leave, this one was in the 'should-I-play-forward-or-back' zone outside off
beaten on the drive. Once again, not much foot work there. Throws his bat at a full delivery slanting across him
punched between cover and point for a comfortable single, the ball skidded off the deck for the first time today for Sran

Chahal has made a royal mess of that one at square leg.  Chibhabha looks to flick, but ends up closing the bat face early. The top edge lobs towards Chahal, who was back-pedaling from square leg but had to also contend with the sun. In the end, he went with his palms facing upwards, only to see the ball burst through his hands.
gets half-forward and defends

walks across the stumps to flick that across the line, but is struck on the pad. A big appeal from Dhawal, but umpire Ian Gould indicates the batsman was struck outside off. Fair call there, the batsman was a couple of steps outside the crease
back of length delivery that shapes away from outside off, left alone
in the channel where most batsmen are indecisive, Sibanda plants forward and sees it thud into Dhoni's gloves
drivable length, but the bat comes down at an angle to roll back off the inside edge to Dhawal on his follow-through

shot of the morning, ah, delicious! This time there's a stamp of authority as the high elbows come down straight to hit that on the up. Bisected cover and mid-off with precision. That should give him immense confidence.
consecutive boundaries for Zimbabwe, has been as rare as the Haley's comet, in this series. Sran overpitches, and this time he simply forces that past mid-off
length ball angling away, left alone
hops onto the back foot and turns it to Chahal at midwicket
pulled across the line, but it wasn't all that short. The ball hurried onto him as well as he played that to mid-on

goes over the infield at cover, but the ball lobs off the top half of the bat. Spongy bounce from the length area on off stump for Sran. It wasn't quite there for the drive, could have so easily chipped it to the fielder at the edge of the circle
looks to work it fine, but can only get some pad as the ball deflects to the leg side
have to say another scoring opportunity missed. Drops it a touch short, there was width too, but Sibanda can only hit it straight to point
excellent delivery, nips away off the seam from outside off, carries waist-high to Dhoni on that occasion
left alone again, once again there's some width to work with but the batsman is happy to bide his time by the looks of it
back of length delivery that jags away off the seam from off stump, left alone
driven on the up, but straight to extra cover, good work by Rayudu moving to his right to stop that
cut well, but can't pierce that packed off side field. He got on top of the bounce while playing that, but there's point and a cover point to prevent a boundary there. Fazal stops it
slants on in from wide of the crease, Sibanda shapes to cut but pulls out. Oversteps in his quest for extra pace, so it will be a free-hit

gets more elevation than distance as he looks to tee off like a golfer. This one was too full, he swung through the line, but got that off the toe end of the bat, Jadhav runs back from mid-on to pull it back in
short of length delivery outside off, gets some lift, Sibanda lets that go
sharp inward movement from outside off, Sibanda leaves once again. Appreciable movement on that occasion
did that take the edge? Umpire says no. The ball cuts through Sibanda who pushes outside the line of the ball. The ball deflects to Dhoni off the flap of the pad
another short of length delivery that nips back in from the fifth stump, he is happy to watch it through to the wicketkeeper
shapes to cut, but is too early into the stroke. Beaten. There was the width he was looking for, so you have to say Bumrah is lucky to get away with that
full outside off, some away movement again, left alone

risky single at the non-striker's end, Sibanda had to dive full length forward to get back into the crease, Fazal with the throw, but it perhaps slipped out of his hand, good backing up though to prevent the overthrow
bowls it a touch ahead of good length outside off, left alone again
shapes to cut but is beaten by some appreciable away movement again, Dhoni is on his knees as he collects it. Signs of inconsistent bounce?
too full to attempt a cut, is beaten by the zip off the surface. This time it thuds into Dhoni's gloves
chops the attempted cut down to third man, once again got that off the bottom of the bat
has Chibhabha hopping on the crease with a short ball that skids back into middle, the ball deflects off the flap of the pad to Dhoni
length ball well outside off on the sixth stump, the width was there for Chibhabha to go over the top but he's happy to let that go
this one bounces awkwardly for Chibhabha who looks to force it off the back foot, wasn't far away from the edge. The ball was angled in but held its line to create the doubt in the batsman's mind
much better from Chibhabha, gets across a touch to defend that back down the pitch with a straight bat
the ball holds its line again after pitching outside off, Chibhabha gets a thick edge down to third man
angling into middle and leg from wide of the crease, plays it gently behind square on the leg side to retain strike
drifts into middle and leg, it's a touch short as well, pulled to deep midwicket
looks to whip that away, but gets far too across as the ball skids back in to hit him on the thigh pad
gets forward to pat it gently to the off side, grip and turn on that occasion
worked with the angle to short fine leg
eased with the spin to Rayudu at backward point
slider on middle, punched back to the bowler
poor from Bumrah again, he's struggling. This one is angled down middle and leg, the ball slides down further as Dhoni moves to his left to stop that
cuts, but straight to Axar at point. Didn't have the width he would have liked
stays inside the crease as he stabs the length ball on off stump to point
straying down leg, batsman falls over as he looks to tickle it fine, Dhoni can't stop it cleanly despite a dive
drivable length again, but misses out on a scoring opportunity. Juicy half-volley, hit straight to mid-off. Came down late on the drive
inward movement from outside off, watched through to the keeper
cuts and misses. Tried to hit that too hard, was beaten for pace as well
loops it nicely on middle, hint of turn away, defended back down the pitch
gives it flight, lands it on off, Chibhabha lofts it with the spin over the infield, Chahal does well at sweeper cover
drifting into middle and leg, nudged to square leg
quicker ball on middle, a touch shorter in length, punched back to the bowler
sees the batsman giving him charge and slows it down further, dabbed back to the bowler
skids one on off stump, pushed to cover.
once again looks to work it across the line, only for him to miss the one that skids back in to hit him on the thigh pad, they take a leg-bye off the deflection to slip
hops across to bunt that down to mid-on as they scamper through for a single
gets half-forward as he steers to backward point
back of length delivery outside off, width there to cut, but he lets it go instead
gets half-forward to dab it gently to point
slants one into his hip, tucked to Pandey at square leg
in-drifter on middle from round the stumps, he gets forward to smother the spin
eased wide of cover for a quick single
steps out to flick, but misses a full ball that was fired in, appeal from Axar but he was too far down the pitch for the umpire to think about it seriously
gets forward and then makes the late adjustment to account for the spin and defend
makes some room and works it wide of cover for an easy single
slow turn from off stump, eased to backward point
lovely flight as he lands it on middle, a touch too full as Sibanda squeezes it back to the bowler
width on offer, and he slaps it straight to cover
driven with the spin to short cover, pressure building
slows it down a touch, the batsman has to lunge forward to defend, angled with soft hands towards point for a quick single, Sibanda had to slide back into the crease
squared up a touch as he negotiates that one late
swept across the line, had to fetch it from outside off, straight to Sran at deep square leg
flighted ball on middle stump, driven with the angle to long-on
slow turn from middle again, pushed with the spin to cover,  he had to check his shot there
gets a thick inside edge as he looks to ease it past cover, long-off comes into play
the in-drifter on middle and leg, nudged to the on side
lunges forward to smother the spin
quicker one on off, plays back to a delivery he could have well prodded forward, somehow gets some bat on it to keep it away

first signs of intent, and he's holded out to Bumrah who takes a good catch at the ropes at long-off. It was beautifully tossed up, the ball swerved away a touch as well as Sibanda got to the pitch, but didn't generate enough power on the stroke as he looked to loft it over the ropes. He was also hitting it towards the bigger straight boundary, where Bumrah, mindful of the ropes behind him, moved a couple of steps backwards to pouch that. The pressure was building, and Chibhabha has fallen into the trap.
stretches his left pad out to keep that away
driven with the spin to cover
tossed up on off stump, eased to sweeper cover
excellent delivery, this one's quicker through the air on middle, he gets the bat in front of the pad to defend
fired into middle, defended back down the pitch
gets forward and blocks
slow turn from middle, he pats it with soft hands
drifts into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
beaten by the fizz. The ball pitches on off and holds its line, Maruma played inside the line
gets half-forward and bunts it to the off side
teases him by gently tossing it up outside off, reaches out to defend
fetches the sweep from outside off towards deep square
sloppy effort at short third man gives away a couple of runs. Faiz Fazal, the man in question. Dived over the ball there
gets a thick edge onto the pad as he looks to drive
that's a jaffa! This one rips away square from the rough on off stump. The drift created the doubt as well
sharp turn from middle, he prods forward tentatively, only to see the ball turn square and beat the edge
in-drifter on middle stump, driven with the spin to cover
pushed back to the bowler, it was the quicker one this time
skids one onto middle from wide of the crease, bunted back to the bowler
works it across the line to midwicket

did that take the edge?  Oh, yes. Definitely. He indicated to Axar that he was lucky to get away with the previous one, and has put down a tough chance when he got it right. This ball drifted in to land on middle and then turn away to take the edge. There was some grip as well as the ball took the edge but Dhoni got up a little more than he would have normally, which meant he was slightly on the move as the ball thudded into his gloves.
driven back past the bowler to long-off
get half-forward to defend
swept across the line to deep backward square leg
leans forward and eases it with the spin to long-off

excellent sweep, bisects deep square and deep midwicket. This one was nicely tossed up outside off, he got down on one knee and went through with the stroke. There was intent there, and he hit it hard
deceived by the googly that pitches on off and rips back into hit him high on the pad
throws it up in the air, but he landed it well outside off, once again Maruma looked to fetch the sweep from outside off but was into the sweep way too early

wow, where did that come from? Loose delivery first up from Sran. He banged it in short, Sibanda rocked back and pulled that into the deep square leg boundary. There was a man there, but he picked the bones out of that one to ensure he was a mere spectator. At no stage did he intend to keep that down, so there was definitely some intent there
whips a length ball to mid-on
what are you doing? Steps out to play a cross-court forehand over mid-off, beaten by the extra bounce. Wonder if there's a message to go after the bowling here
gets forward to bunt it towards the man coming in from cover
too full and he's hammered that over the infield, didn't quite get it off the middle even though there was room for him to go through with the lofted hit. Mid-off runs back to stop that
clever cricket, drops it into the off side towards point, his partner responds to the early call and they complete the run without much fuss
lovely, lovely drive. Leans forward, gets into a wonderful position to ease that drive with the spin towards deep extra cover
drifts one into middle, a touch fuller as well, squeezed back to the bowler
stretches forward to play it with the spin to point
reaches out to drive, toe-ends it to the cover fielder
pushed through quicker, wonder if he tried to bowl the flipper there, he shapes to cut but withdraws and dabs it instead
gets forward and drives it to mid-off
floats it full on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
slices it down to third man, didn't quite generate the power as he reached out to loft that half-volley over cover

a misfield at mid-on and that will run away into the boundary. To be fair to Faiz Fazal, it was slapped off the middle of the bat. He tumbled to his left to stop that, but the ball hit the top of his fingers. That it still had enough to race away to the boundary is an indication of how hard he hit that.  Looks like Fazal has hurt his finger, but is staying on
gets a thick outside edge down to third man
stands tall and punches it wide of cover for a quick single
beautiful drive. Half-volley that has been caressed straight to deep cover. A metre on either side and it was four probably
driven with the spin to wide long-off, once again nice flight from Chahal
this one fizzes off from middle as it's bowled quicker through the air, he prods forward and defends
rushed into the stroke, it was the top spinner that angled back into middle to take a thick inside edge to the on side

a dismissal any legspinner would be proud of. This was generously tossed up, but the batsman had to lunge forward to get to the pitch. But Sibanda made the mistake of looking to work it across the line and closed the bat face a little too early, only to see the ball lob back to the bowler off the leading edge. Second wicket for Chahal, who continues to impress. He was denied a wicket in the last over, but it doesn't take long for him to strike back.  Chahal put him down on nought, but now has his man!  Sweet revenge
gets forward to bunt it back to the bowler
wrong'un on middle, nudged behind square on the leg side
slower and fuller outside off, Waller shoulders arms, through to Dhoni on the second bounce
stays inside the crease to angle the away-going delivery to third man

crunching cover drive into the gap in the deep, Dhawal Kulkarni had to run around 20 yards to his right to get to the ball, which he did well. Bit of miscommunication between both batsmen, but they complete the run in the end
hit hard again, but straight to cover. It was overpitched, and again they failed to capitalise
opens the face of the bat to ease it wide of point
gentle half-volley angling away, driven to sweeper cover for an easy single
hops back and crunches that off the backfoot to deep point
cuts back in from outside off on wide of the crease, dabbed to point
cuts, but can't pick the gap between point and short third man
steps out to go over the top, but is cramped for room. Chopped back to the bowler off the inside edge
turned to square leg
floats it full on the stumps from wide of the crease, pushed to midwicket for a quick single, he had to scamper through as Jadhav fired a quick throw at the bowler's end
opens his wrists nicely to steer that short ball behind point
punched with the angle to wide long-on to bring up Zimbabwe's 100
slower through the air as he lands it on off stump, eased wide of cover for an easy single
swept across the line, steeped with risk there, Sran in business at deep square leg
drift and turn from middle, driven straight to cover
gives it plenty of air as he lands it on off, Waller looks to slap that over cover but ends up slicing it to point
in the slot to drive, but he can't pick the gap, straight to Jadhav at mid-off
jags back in from outside off, Waller shoulders arms
squeezed back to the bowler, this one angles back in full from wide of the crease
arches back and then uses the room to cut that down to Sran at third man, he nearly over-ran that one

got him! That's a beauty. He has got the ball to cut back in all afternoon, and has been finally rewarded. There was no conviction whatsoever from Maruma who pushes outside the line of the stumps, only to see the ball break back in to sneak through and flatten the off stump. He made the mistake of simply hanging his bat out, and paid the price

sets him up superbly! He was waiting for a short one and was well inside the crease. Bumrah does well to float it full as the ball tails away just a touch to take the edge through to MS Dhoni. 350th victim for the Indian captain. Smiles all around. Chigumbura is out for another duck, his poor run of form continues. Zimbabwe on a free-fall, not for the first time in the series.

what is happening? Zimbabwe are committing hara-kiri here. Waller takes off for a single as soon as he hits it to cover, but is partner is guilty of ball-watching. He was more than halfway down the pitch when sent back. KL Rahul, moving to his left, had enough time to lob the throw to Dhoni, who whipped the bails off. Waller indicates to his partner that there was clearly a run there as it was hit wide of the fielder. He mumbles a few words as he walks off.

Castle Corner is outraged, and they have every reason to be. Typical Axar Patel delivery. He drifts this one into off stump from wide of the crease, Cremer is caught on the crease as he prods outside the line of the delivery that skids on to hit the pad. As plumb as it can get! He may have not had his pads on five minutes back. Now he has all the time in the world to take them off. Poor from Zimbabwe
slides one through on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
driven with the spin to cover
slow turn from middle, shortened his length as well, defended back to the bowler
plays that one across the line to the leg side, would have been caught plumb in front had he missed that

set him up for the lbw, and the plan nearly worked. There were two slips in place to suggest he may have looked to bowl the outswinger, but this one skids back into middle from wide of the crease, Madziva is late on the shot but somehow manages to get some bat on it to keep that out
there's a gift and he's put that away. Too full and angling down leg, and he's flicked that with the angle into the deep square leg boundary

beautiful ball from Bumrah. This one holds its line after pitching on off, Mutumbami is drawn forward by the length and gets thick edge as Rahul dives low to his left to complete the catch at slip . The ball flew off the bat, but Rahul kept his eyes on the ball right till it lodged into his hands. He put down a few the other day, both at training and in the match, but has looked much sharper today.
angled into middle and leg, the ball deflects off the pad to midwicket
hint of reverse back into middle and off, Mupariwa plays outside the line to get an inside edge
once again hangs back to ease it behind point, can only chop it to the off side. Excellent over from Bumrah
beaten by the slider that holds its line from around the stumps.
gets half-forward and eases it to cover
quicker one on middle, bunted to the off side
arm ball from wide of the crease, pats it wide of cover for a quick single, Fazal was a little late to get to the ball
lunges forward to smother the spin
pushes outside the line, gets an inside edge to short fine leg. Confusion again between the two batsmen, no damage down in the end
yorker-length ball on middle, squeezes it to the off side
gets forward to keep that full ball out, cover fielder into the picture again
nips back in from outside off, left alone

outside edge, and gone again. This time, it's Pandey at second slip. Mupariwa goes for an expansive drive again, but looked to do so with an opened-face, was clearly beaten by the pace of the ball as the edge flew into Pandey's safe hands. Bumrah is having a field day, and the angles have once again worked wonderfully for him. He's had a few nip back in, while others have held their line to cause the confusion. Top stuff this
stays inside the crease to defend the length ball on off stump
angles one full on the stumps from wide of the crease, Tiripano jams his bat down in time to keep that out
steps out and defend to cover
rapped on the pad as he looks to fetch the sweep from outside off, the ball was sliding down leg
worked wide of square leg for an easy single
fired into middle, pushed to cover
slows it down nicely as he lands it on off, defended to short cover
stretches forward and blocks
appeal for lbw as Madviza is hit high on his right pad. Would have definitely gone over
beaten, close shave again. The length ball nips back in a touch to whizz past the outside edge as Madziva prods forward tentatively
back of length delivery outside off, steered to point
fuller in length this time, Madziva opens the bat face to play it to Chahal at gully
gives him the charge, but Bumrah sees that early and bowls the off-cutter, squeezed towards cover point for a quick single
takes a thick inside edge to square leg as Tiripano defends cautiously
tossed up on off stump, pushed past the bowler
driven with the spin to long-off

just eludes Rayudu at short third-man, it was a top effort, I have to say. This was a touch short, Tiripano threw his bat at that to get a thick edge that flew off the blade. Rayudu dived full-length to his left but couldn't quite get his hands on that
presses forward to defend
did he pick the wrong'un? Not quite sure, but he was mighty. Looks to heave that over midwicket, but gets a thick inside edge that saved the ball from crashing into the stumps
this time it's a slider on middle, just gets his bat down in time to keep that out
angles a length ball back into middle from wide of the crease, tapped to the on side
squared up by a length ball that holds its line on off stump, pushed with hard hands
looks to flick, but the ball flies off the leading edge over cover
driven using the full face back to Bumrah, who threatens to throw the ball back to the striker, even without getting his hand on the bal
opens the bat face late to run that one down to third man
text book forward defense on that occasion
drifts one into middle and leg, played back down the pitch
loops it up nicely, Madziva steps out and then adjusts to ease it wide of cover
quicker one on middle, played back down the pitch again
wrong'un on off,  he shoulders arms but was struck well outside the line of the stumps
flicked to midwicket where Jadhav misfields to concede a single
nicely tossed up on off stump, he gets a good stride forward to keep that out
slides one down leg, Tiripano can't get the faint tickle that could have given him a few runs
floats one at length on middle and leg, solid defense

what athleticism from Dhawal Kulkarni! Sprints across on his follow-through to pick up the ball, then turn around and fire a throw at the bowler's end, and he's hit the stumps. Not sure what Tiripano was thinking, but a dive could have saved him there. He also made the mistake of running diagonally, and that may have cost him a yard or two

inn2.comm: gets some lift off the deck as he bowls a short of length delivery outside off, Rahul jabs if off the backfoot as the ball rolls behind the wicket
skids one at length on off stump, punched to mid-off
hops onto the back foot to force that to cover point
crunched but an outstanding stop by Maruma at point, that should sting! He moved low to his left to stop that
jags back in off the deck from outside off, Rahul is back initially before he covers the line to dab that to the off side
back of length delivery on off stump, Rahul gets on top of the bounce and defends
peach of a delivery first up. Angles it full and across Fazal, who feels for the ball outside off, could have so easily nicked that
looks to turn one to midwicket, but the ball straightens to take the outer half of the bat as it rolls to the off side
first runs in international cricket for Fazal.  Leans forward to play a square drive, gets a thick edge down to third man
appreciable swing back in from well outside off, Rahul shapes to drive but quickly checks his stroke, gets a thick edge down to third man
gets forward and across as he solidly defends a full ball to extra cover
slides it on middle and leg, was he looking for the inswing after sliding a few across? His wrist position suggested so. Good take by the keeper
nips away off the seam from outside off, left alone
hustles a length ball on the stumps, played back down the pitch
driven gently between cover and mid-off for a quick single
right length, but wrong line. This one's back of length on middle and leg, nudged behind square on the leg side
looks to drive, but gets a thick inside edge to midwicket. Tiripano is angling then in here and getting a few to jag back in off the seam
punched, but can't pick the gap. There are two cover fielders precisely for that
taps it with soft hands towards the fielder running in cover, quick single taken
full outside off, crunched on the up to cover
looks to play a square drive, chops one into the off side for a quick single
floats a full delivery across Fazal, who watches it through to the keeper
leans forward and plays an on-drive straight to mid-on
calls for a single, but is sent back. A solid front foot defense to short cover
gentle half-volley on the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg
turns the bat face a little too early as the ball nips away a touch to take the leading edge, rolls to point. There was a hint of grip for the bowler there
top shot, but won't get a boundary. It was on the pads, and he wristed that beautifully over square leg. Good balance, excellent timing, but the outfield that side is a little too heavy
tests the bounce of the surface by banging one short outside off, Rahul sways out of the way. Right call from the umpire, it was well over Rahul's head
another bounce, he tumbles over again on his follow-through. Way over Rahul's head as he ducked under it
stands tall and punches the length ball to cover
chops one to point. Didn't have the width he would have liked
uses the pace of the bowler to run it down to third man for an easy single
gets on top of the bounce and defends it solidly to the off side
some swing in the air as Rahul is lured forward, defended to cover
sharp single to Cremer at mid-off, it was almost an afterthought from Rahul, but Fazal trusted his partner's call. Not sure if these two have batted together in domestic cricket before. Unlikely
yorker-length delivery angling away, squeezed down to third man with an angled bat
on the pads, Rahul looks to flick, but can only manage a thick inside edge to wide mid-on. The bat face turned in his hand as ball thudded into his big broad blade

that is a beautiful shot! Balance, timing, placement - all perfect. A half-volley that was begging to be hit, and Fazal took full toll of that. Presented the full face as he eased down down the ground past mid-off. Didn't look to hit it hard
on the pads, flicked to midwicket
angles a length ball outside off to the left of point for a quick single

excellent delivery, Fazal hangs his bat out at that length ball without any conviction, pulled out of it in the end, but it ws a touch late. May have been in trouble had the ball nipped back in. Didn't miss the edge by much
driven down the ground, but straight to mid-off. Rahul skipped outside the crease, but was heard the loud call of 'no'
poor ball, sliding down leg as Fazal misses the attempted pick up shot over square leg

he's definitely looking edgy here as he looks to pull out of a shot he was committed to. Length ball on the stumps, Fazal looks to force it on the up but ends up offering a defensive shot, gets an inside edge onto the pad
hops back and taps it back down the pitch
gets half-forward to ease the away-going delivery to point
angles a length ball on middle from wide of the crease, punched to cover

wonder why you'd want to risk one run when you have all afternoon to get these. It was bunted to the man running in from cover point, but Rahul had extra ground to make as he was pushed back into the crease when he played that. A direct hit at the bowler's end would have made it interesting
poor delivery, slides that down leg stump. Looked for the inswing. Some exercise for Ian Gould after a nice hearty lunch
gorgeous!  Looks elegant when he plays on the up. Planted the foot forward, covered the swing and simply caressed the ball between cover and point. Weight was transferred forward when he made contact
drops the ball into the off side with soft hands for a quick single
overpitched outside off, Rahul crunches the cover drive but can't piece the gap
flicked from outside off to mid-on
poor start, gets the ball to swing in but starts from leg stump to make it a wide, Fazal is a touch overbalanced as he looks to tickle it fine
drifting down leg again, this time Fazal nudges it down to deep fine leg
invites the drive by bowling it full outside off, not much swing this time, Fazal shoulders arms
beaten by a peach! He's drawn forward, but the ball leaves him late as Fazal pushes forward without much feet movement
ah, beautiful! Width on offer, and he's crashed that into the cover boundary. Stretches forward, frees his arms and crunches that
presses forward and defends it solidly
opens the face of the bat to bunt it to point
width outside off, punched into the gap at cover, back for the second easily
short of length delivery on middle, pushed back past the bowler
floats it full on the stumps, Rahul gets forward and offers a dead bat

shot of the afternoon. Gentle half-volley that had 'hit me' written all over it at 120 clicks. Rahul climbed onto that in a jiffy. Lent forward and crashed it between cover and mid-off. He didn't even bother running. A touch of disdain in that stroke
eases that on the up to cover
gets half-forward to stab that towards point
length ball slanting across on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
play and a miss. Looks to run it down but is beaten by the angle and the late away movement
a second's indecision there, wasn't sure whether to press forward or back, pushes his bat out in the end and gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
looks to work it across the line, is overbalanced as he drives it back to the bowler. Wanted to hit it past mid-on
looks to drive again, can only manage to get a thick inside edge to mid-on
challenges short mid-on by bunting it there and taking off for a risky single, the fielder was off balance when he got to the ball, which meant the throw was weak
juicy full toss on middle, whipped across the line to long-on
flicked with the spin to midwicket
flatter one on middle and off, Fazal waits for it to spin back in and plays it to the off side
hit on the flap of the pad as he looks to work it into the on side
steps out and works it with the spin to long-on
tossed up on middle, Rahul makes some room and eases it to cover
bowls that from close to the stumps, floated at length on middle, Fazal dabs it back down the pitch gently
solid front foot defense again, he has all the time in the world to get these runs and is in no hurry whatsoever
looks to walk across to flick, misses the ball as it deflects off the pad to square leg
full-blooded straight drive that has raced past the bowler even before he had completed a couple of steps on his follow-through
follows that up with a magnificent cover drive. This wasn't a half-volley, but there was width for him to press forward and slap it between cover and mid-off, which he did to perfection

make that three in a row. That is the best of the lot! There was an extra fielder who had been brought into the ring on the off side, but it doesn't matter. Mupariwa drops it short again, Rahul who pressed forward waited for the bounce before flaying that between cover and point
sweeps and misses, but the ball pitched well outside leg
gets to the pitch of the ball as he works it with the spin to long-on
full toss on the pads, worked into the gap at deep midwicket
opens up the off side field by clearing his front leg and then driving that inside-out into the gap between deep cover and long-off, he's timing them beautifully here
leading edge past cover point, enough dip to force a false shot
this time the wrong'un, which he doesn't pick straightaway, pushed awkwardly to the off side
eased wide of cover for a quick single

works it wide of square leg, the boundary rider had to come in a long way, enough for Fazal to get back for the second. Also the fact that he was a couple of yards outside the crease helped him complete the first run quickly
uses the pace to open the bat face and glide it down to third man
gets forward to pat that to the off side
Chibhabha dives to his right to effect a one-handed stop at extra cover, it was crunched by Rahul and would have certainly been four had Chibhabha missed that
gully was in business for a split-second, but it was a very tough chance. Rahul doesn't quite have the room he would have liked as he looks to slap that past point, the edge flies down to third man

shot of a man in form. Steps out, gets to the pitch of the ball and hits it straight as a dye, into the sightscreen. Went through with a straight bat and at no stage intended to hit it along the ground
worked wide of midwicket for an easy single
misses out on a scoring opportunity, was sitting up nicely for him to cut it behind square, but hit it straight to point
eased past the bowler to long-off
flatter one on off stump, breaks away a touch, Rahul stays inside the crease as he punches it back down the pitch

beautifully bowled. Rahul is deceived in flight as he steps out to go down town, ends up slicing it over point. The man in the deep reacted a second or two late, but he didn't have much of a chance even if he did get off the blocks early as it falls in no man's land. Unnecessary from Rahul. There was a fielder running backwards as well, but no one called clearly
opens the face of the bat and runs it down to square third man
firm push to mid-off, calls no immediately though
overbalanced as he shapes to flick, in the end makes a late adjustment by pushing it off the frontfoot to cover
dabbed gently to short cover for a quick single, Fazal responds immediately for a run that wasn't entirely risk-free
timing and placement, impeccable as the straight bat comes down to caress the length ball on the up, bisected mid-on and mid-off. Delightful to say the least
was through with the pull even before the ball got to him, lobs off the back blade to the off side
drifts into middle, Rahul's drive finds a thick inside edge to short midwicket
leans forward and wrists it wide of midwicket
half-tracker on middle and leg, pulled with the spin to deep backward square leg
worked wide of mid-on, Cremer runs across quickly to keep that down to a single
rolls off the pad as he looks to play a fine paddle sweep with the spin, this was fired in full but pitched outside leg
first six of his international career is superbly timed straight hit. Sees the flight, dances down the track, gets to the pitch and simply swings through the line to get the elevation. Top shot!
eased wide of cover to get to a maiden ODI half-century, applause from his mates in the dressing room. This has been a measured knock
play and a miss, the ball thuds into Mutumbami's thigh on the bounce, ouch, painful blow
mistimes a cut to cover. It was short, but didn't have the width for him to play it wide of point
works it with the angle to the man running in from short midwicket for a quick single

wow, that is a scorcher late in the afternoon, sure to have lit up a few houses around Nagpur and elsewhere in Vidarbha and India. Length ball outside off, he leans forward and cracks that on the up between cover and mid-off. Stamp of authority written all over the stroke. Mid-off thought he was in with a chance, but gave up very soon

takes on the short ball this time, ah, the thing confidence can do to a batsman. The ball got big on him or so it looked like, but Fazal ensured he adjusted to the bounce and ensured there were no half-measures as he went through with the hook, fine leg could have done better to get to the ball there
back of length delivery outside off, punched to deep point
presses forward to defend that full delivery tailing away from off stump
floats a full delivery across Fazal, who gets forward to pat it towards cover
eased to mid-off for a quick single
rolls his wrists over the ball to play it to midwicket
angles one full on middle from wide of the crease, defended to the on side
controls the pull well to help it down to fine leg to bring up a  maiden ODI fifty.  Controlled knock studded with some elegant strokes
picks the length early and pulls it down to deep fine leg
uses the angle to run it down to third man to amble across for a single
back of length delivery on off stump, gets some lift off the deck to hit the top half of Rahul's bat as he plays it to mid-off
sensibly done, gentle dab to the off side for a quick single
full and angling away from off stump, he gets forward and blocks
length ball angling away, runs it down to third man, who was caught napping
confusion, confusion. Rahul wanted the run, but is sent back as he dabs it to point. Rahul had to dive full length, even as Madziva swooped in from cover to fire an under-arm throw

he's picked the bones out of that one. That's massive! Length ball on middle, Rahul was winding up like he'd decided yesterday that he will hit this one out of the park, and swung through cleanly as the ball lands in the stands at long-on
works it wide of square leg for an easy single

game, set and match!  Brings up the winning runs with an imperious pull in front of square as Fazal wraps up a memorable debut. Too short and angling away, Fazal rocks back and then fetches the pull from outside off. Also does well to roll his wrists over that to keep it down. Smiles all around.
